commenter_a: In all honesty, this sounds like a disgruntled employee... all of the African Americans employed, & previously employed at Versace... he's the only one to disclose this... people buy into anything where race is concerned. I'm African American, I shop high end... I've definitely experienced Racism while shopping, but I could literally count the incidents. Racism is very real, but it's being used and over used to justify everything! However, if this is true, why did he wait until he was fired to speak up. Also, why have none of the other African American employees past or present come out to support him?
post_message: The store employees were taught during training to say "D410" whenever a black customer entered the store, according to the lawsuit.
